title: China's Covid-era witness Zhang Zhan reportedly sentenced to jail in new case

subhed: Lawyer Zhang Zhan, disbarred for her human rights activism, was arrested again in August 2024, just a few months after finishing her first four-year prison sentence following the Wuhan lockdown.

subhed: Each fall, the event opens doors to historic sites that are usually closed to the public. Le Monde picks 11 of the most compelling hidden gems in France.

title: Historian Tal Bruttmann's sharp eye on the Holocaust
subhed: In his latest book, the French historian continues his investigation into the photographs taken by the SS in 1944 at Auschwitz – archives that had never been used before – and tirelessly challenges misconceptions about the Holocaust.

title: France's situation causes concern in Brussels
French protestors caught between anger and disillusionment
subhed: Eight days after the 'Block Everything' protest movement on September 10, the union coalition called for mobilization against 'austerity' on Thursday, September 18. More than 250 gatherings took place across France, demanding a change in political direction and greater tax justice.

title: Laure Foucher: 'Israel is doing everything it can to exclude France from the Middle East'

title: Marie Antoinette is crowned queen of fashion
subhed: Until March 22, 2026, the Victoria and Albert Museum in London is showcasing spectacular silk, embroidered and train dresses, as well as jewelry and objects that reveal a more intimate side of Louis XVI's wife.
